com.swirlds.platform

Class Address

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swirlds.platform.Address

  • public class Address
extends java.lang.Object
    One address in an address book, including all the info about a member. It is immutable. Each getter for a byte array returns a clone of that array. The constructor clones all the arrays passed to it. Each "copySet" simply returns a new deep copy with one variable different. So it isn't a setter, but is a variant of the builder design pattern without a separate build() method.

      • Address

        public Address()

      • Address

        public Address(long id,
               java.lang.String nickname,
               java.lang.String selfName,
               long stake,
               boolean ownHost,
               byte[] addressInternalIpv4,
               int portInternalIpv4,
               byte[] addressExternalIpv4,
               int portExternalIpv4,
               byte[] addressInternalIpv6,
               int portInternalIpv6,
               byte[] addressExternalIpv6,
               int portExternalIpv6,
               java.security.PublicKey sigPublicKey,
               java.security.PublicKey encPublicKey,
               java.security.PublicKey agreePublicKey)
        constructor for a mutable address for one member.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID for that member
        nickname - the name given to that member by the member creating this address
        selfName - the name given to that member by themself
        stake - the amount of stake (0 if they should have no influence on the consensus)
        ownHost - is that member running on the same machine as the member creating this address?
        addressInternalIpv4 - IPv4 address on the inside of the NATing router
        portInternalIpv4 - port for the internal IPv4 address
        addressExternalIpv4 - IPv4 address on the outside of the NATing router (same as internal if there is no NAT)
        portExternalIpv4 - port port for the external IPv4 address
        addressInternalIpv6 - IPv6 address on the inside of the NATing router
        portInternalIpv6 - port for the internal IPv6 address
        addressExternalIpv6 - address on the outside of the NATing router
        portExternalIpv6 - port for the external IPv6 address
        sigPublicKey - public key used for signing
        encPublicKey - public key used for encryption
        agreePublicKey - public key used for key agreement in TLS
